For Hilt to work properly in Android apps, both the Application class AND at least one Activity (typically MainActivity) must be annotated. The Application class needs @HiltAndroidApp, and the main Activity needs @AndroidEntryPoint. Without @AndroidEntryPoint on an Activity, Hilt's component generation may be incomplete, causing "no main class found" errors because Hilt_<AppName>Application doesn't get generated.
